data.chText: 作为
data.enText: what sb does

data.chText: 行动；行为过程
data.enText: the process of doing sth in order to make sth happen or to deal with a situation

data.chText: 若要使这些美丽的动物能生存下去，现在就要行动起来。
data.enText: The time has come for action if these beautiful animals are to survive.

data.chText: 消防队员立即采取了行动制止大火蔓延。
data.enText: Firefighters took action immediately to stop the blaze spreading.

data.chText: 在这种情况下最佳行动方针是什么？
data.enText: What is the best course of action in the circumstances?

data.chText: 她开始向小组讲解她的行动计划。
data.enText: She began to explain her plan of action to the group.

data.chText: 所做之事；行为
data.enText: a thing that sb does

data.chText: 她行动迅速，救了小孩的命。
data.enText: Her quick action saved the child's life.

data.chText: 我们每个人都必须对自己的行为负责。
data.enText: Each of us must take responsibility for our own actions.

data.chText: 诉讼程序
data.enText: legal process

data.chText: 诉讼；起诉
data.enText: a legal process to stop a person or company from doing sth, or to make them pay for a mistake, etc.

data.chText: 发表该文章的杂志将受到诽谤诉讼。
data.enText: A libel action is being brought against the magazine that published the article.

data.chText: 他正考虑起诉这家医院。
data.enText: He is considering taking legal action against the hospital.

data.chText: 战争
data.enText: in war

data.chText: 战斗；作战
data.enText: fighting in a battle or war

data.chText: 军事行动
data.enText: military action

data.chText: 阵亡战士
data.enText: soldiers killed in action

data.chText: 故事；戏剧
data.enText: in story/play

data.chText: （故事、戏剧等中的）情节
data.enText: the events in a story, play, etc.

data.chText: 这个故事发生在法国。
data.enText: The action takes place in France.

data.chText: 激动人心的事
data.enText: exciting events

data.chText: 激动人心的事
data.enText: exciting events

data.chText: 我喜欢情节曲折离奇的影片。
data.enText: I like films with plenty of action.

data.chText: 纽约是个热闹活跃的地方。
data.enText: New York is where the action is .

data.chText: 作用
data.enText: effect

data.chText: （一种物质或化学品对另一种所起的）作用
data.enText: the effect that one substance or chemical has on another

data.chText: 阳光对皮肤的作用
data.enText: the action of sunlight on the skin

data.chText: 身体部位
data.enText: of part of the body

data.chText: （身体部位的）动作，功能
data.enText: the way a part of the body moves or functions

data.chText: 对肝功能的研究
data.enText: a study of the action of the liver

data.chText: 机器
data.enText: of machine

data.chText: （钢琴、枪炮、钟表等的）机械装置，活动部件；（机械部件的）活动方式
data.enText: the mechanical parts of a piano, gun, clock, etc. or the way the parts move
actions speak louder than words

data.chText: 行动比言语更为响亮
data.enText: what a person actually does means more than what they say they will do
in action

data.chText: 在活动中；在运转
data.enText: if sb/sth is in action , they are doing the activity or work that is typical for them

data.chText: 只要按一下电钮就可以看到你喜欢的角色在表演。
data.enText: Just press the button to see your favourite character in action.

data.chText: 我还得看所有参赛者的实地比赛。
data.enText: I've yet to see all the players in action.
into action

data.chText: 实行；实施
data.enText: if you put an idea or a plan into action , you start making it happen or work

data.chText: 新的交通管理方案正在试验实施。
data.enText: The new plan for traffic control is being put into action on an experimental basis.
out of action

data.chText: 不能工作；失去作用；停止运转
data.enText: not able to work or be used because of injury or damage

data.chText: 乔恩断了一条腿，将有几个星期不能工作。
data.enText: Jon will be out of action for weeks with a broken leg.

data.chText: 复印机今天出故障了。
data.enText: The photocopier is out of action today.
a piece/slice of the action

data.chText: 插手，参与（尤指为了赚钱）
data.enText: a share or role in an interesting or exciting activity, especially in order to make money

data.chText: 要是新机场开始修建，外国公司都会来插一手捞好处。
data.enText: Foreign firms will all want a piece of the action if the new airport goes ahead.
take evasive action

data.chText: 采取回避行动（以避免危险或不愉快）
data.enText: to act in order to avoid danger or an unpleasant situation
spring into action
spring into/to life

data.chText: 突然工作（或行动）起来
data.enText: to suddenly start working or doing sth

data.chText: 他突然行动起来，说道：“咱们走！”
data.enText: ‘Let's go!’ he said, springing into action.

data.chText: 狂欢节期间，全城突然热闹起来。
data.enText: The town springs into life (= becomes busy) during the carnival.
swing into action

data.chText: 立即行动起来；马上大干起来
data.enText: to start doing sth quickly and with a lot of energy

data.chText: 务必做，确保处理（某事）
data.enText: to make sure that sth is done or dealt with

data.chText: 你的要求会处理的。
data.enText: Your request will be actioned.

data.text: action ♦ move ♦ act ♦ gesture ♦ deed ♦ feat

data.chText: 以上各词均指行为、行动。
data.enText: These are all words for a thing that sb does.
action

data.chText: 指行动、动作：
data.enText: a thing that sb does

data.chText: 她行动迅速，救了小孩的命。
data.enText: Her quick action saved the child's life.
move

data.chText: （尤用于新闻）指为达到某目标而采取或需要采取的行动：
data.enText: (used especially in journalism) an action that you do or need to do to achieve sth

data.chText: 他们在等待民意测验的结果，然后再决定下一步行动。
data.enText: They are waiting for the results of the opinion polls before deciding their next move.
act

data.chText: 指行为、行动、所为：
data.enText: a thing that sb does

data.chText: 善行
data.enText: an act of kindness

data.chText: 用action还是act？
这两个词意义相同，但用于不同的句型。act后常跟of，而且 / 或常与形容词连用。action通常不与of连用，但常与his、her等词连用：
data.enText: These two words have the same meaning but are used in different patterns. An act is usually followed by of and/or used with an adjective. Action is not usually used with of but is often used with his , her , etc.

data.chText: 英勇壮举
data.enText: a heroic act of bravery
a heroic action of bravery

data.chText: 他在战争中的英雄壮举
data.enText: his heroic actions/acts during the war

data.chText: action常与take搭配，act则不能：
data.enText: Action often combines with take but act does not.
We shall take whatever acts are necessary.
action or act?
gesture

data.chText: 指表达情感或意图的举动或言语：
data.enText: a thing that you do or say to show a particular feeling or intention

data.chText: 他们送了一些花表示慰问。
data.enText: They sent some flowers as a gesture of sympathy.
deed

data.chText: 通常指良好或不良的行为、行动：
data.enText: ( formal , literary ) a thing that sb does that is usually very good or very bad

data.chText: 英雄事迹；罪恶行为
data.enText: heroic/evil deeds
feat

data.chText: 指需要技巧、气力或勇气的成就或业绩：
data.enText: ( approving ) an action or piece of work that needs skill, strength or courage

data.chText: 这条隧道是工程方面的辉煌成就。
data.enText: The tunnel is a brilliant feat of engineering.
a(n) act/gesture/feat of sth
to perform a(n) action/act/deed/feat
to make a move/gesture
a heroic/brave/daring action/move/act/gesture/deed/feat
a kind/charitable/generous action/act/gesture/deed
a(n) evil/terrible action/act/deed

ex.chText: 要看一个人的行为而不是他的言辞。
ex.enText: It is a man's actions that matter, not his words.

ex.chText: 她为自己的行为感到歉疚。
ex.enText: She was sorry for her actions.

synonyms.bx: 指具体的或抽象的行为过程或所做之事。

ex.chText: 快活的神情
ex.enText: a cheerful air

ex.chText: 批评家的风度
ex.enText: the air of a critic

ex.chText: 这位候选人看着他的支持者们，神态坚定果断。
ex.enText: The candidate looked at his supporters with a determined air.

synonyms.bx: 作此义解时通常要加冠词，指一个人表现出来的风度、气派、面貌。

ex.chText: 军人的举止/傲慢的态度
ex.enText: a military/proud bearing

ex.chText: 新来的首席执行官气度不凡。
ex.enText: The new CEO has a distinguished bearing.

ex.chText: 后来她以饱含热情的笔触写到了他的举止和行为。
ex.enText: She later wrote warmly of his bearing and behaviour.

synonyms.bx: 尤指能够体现出性格特点的行为举止，如站立、行走的姿态等。

ex.chText: 仆人行为可嘉，被她留了下来。
ex.enText: She kept the servant because of his good conduct/behaviour.

ex.chText: 听到你在学校表现良好，我很高兴。
ex.enText: I'm glad to hear of your good conduct/behaviour at school.

synonyms.bx: 指人在某个地方或某种情况下的表现，尤指在公开场合、工作岗位上的行为，常可与 behaviour 换用。

ex.chText: 他对妻子态度粗暴。
ex.enText: He has a rude manner towards his wife.

ex.chText: 那个小女孩总是很有礼貌。
ex.enText: The little girl always has good manners.

ex.chText: 他是研究古人礼仪的专家。
ex.enText: He is an expert on the manners of the ancients.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指对待其他人的态度和行为方式，不涉及道德规范，仅指符合传统的礼仪和要求。其复数形式 manners 指礼貌、规矩，多用于社交活动。

ex.chText: 我们在打一场正义战争。
ex.enText: We are fighting a just war.

ex.chText: 和平的曙光已经出现，但战争的危险依然存在。
ex.enText: The dawn of peace has appeared, but the danger of war still remains.

ex.chText: 人类必须结束战争，否则战争就会毁灭人类。
ex.enText: Mankind must put an end to war, or war will put an end to mankind.

synonyms.bx: 通常指敌对国家之间或国内敌对势力之间进行的大规模武力战争，其中可包括多个战役（battle）。

ex.chText: 他的儿子在越战中阵亡。
ex.enText: His son was killed in action in Vietnam.

ex.chText: 他们跟更为强大的军队作战。
ex.enText: They went into action against superior forces.

ex.chText: 军事战斗可以避免吗？
ex.enText: Can military action be avoided?

synonyms.bx: 指战争中的军事行动，为不可数名词。

ex.chText: 那是整个战争中最为关键的一次战役。
ex.enText: It was the most crucial battle in the whole war.

ex.chText: 经过一场决战后，我们取得了战争的胜利。
ex.enText: We won the war after a decisive battle.

synonyms.bx: 通常指敌对双方的军队之间的交战，尤指大型战争中的某一次战役。

ex.chText: 吉尔下士阵亡了。
ex.enText: Corporal Jill was killed in combat/action.

ex.chText: 他们在战斗中被彻底击败。
ex.enText: They were decisively defeated in combat/action.

ex.chText: 士兵们接受了徒手格斗训练。
ex.enText: The soldiers were trained in unarmed combat.

synonyms.bx: 指战争中的军事行动，尤指小规模的战斗，作此义解时常可与action 换用；也可指人或群体间的打斗。

ex.chText: 经过一场激战，敌人向我军投降了。
ex.enText: After a fierce fight, the enemy yielded to our army.

ex.chText: 士兵们在战斗中用尽了所有的弹药。
ex.enText: The soldiers expended all their ammunition in the fight.

ex.chText: 汤姆老是在学校打架。
ex.enText: Tom's always getting into fights at school.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，尤指敌对军队间为争夺某一地方或位置而进行的战斗，也可指人或帮派之间的争斗。

data.enText: actions speak louder than words

data.chText: 行动比言语更为响亮
data.enText: what a person actually does means more than what they say they will do
in action

data.chText: 在活动中；在运转
data.enText: if sb/sth is in action , they are doing the activity or work that is typical for them

data.chText: 只要按一下电钮就可以看到你喜欢的角色在表演。
data.enText: Just press the button to see your favourite character in action.

data.chText: 我还得看所有参赛者的实地比赛。
data.enText: I've yet to see all the players in action.
into action

data.chText: 实行；实施
data.enText: if you put an idea or a plan into action , you start making it happen or work

data.chText: 新的交通管理方案正在试验实施。
data.enText: The new plan for traffic control is being put into action on an experimental basis.
out of action

data.chText: 不能工作；失去作用；停止运转
data.enText: not able to work or be used because of injury or damage

data.chText: 乔恩断了一条腿，将有几个星期不能工作。
data.enText: Jon will be out of action for weeks with a broken leg.

data.chText: 复印机今天出故障了。
data.enText: The photocopier is out of action today.
a piece/slice of the action

data.chText: 插手，参与（尤指为了赚钱）
data.enText: a share or role in an interesting or exciting activity, especially in order to make money

data.chText: 要是新机场开始修建，外国公司都会来插一手捞好处。
data.enText: Foreign firms will all want a piece of the action if the new airport goes ahead.
take evasive action

data.chText: 采取回避行动（以避免危险或不愉快）
data.enText: to act in order to avoid danger or an unpleasant situation
spring into action
spring into/to life

data.chText: 突然工作（或行动）起来
data.enText: to suddenly start working or doing sth

data.chText: 他突然行动起来，说道：“咱们走！”
data.enText: ‘Let's go!’ he said, springing into action.

data.chText: 狂欢节期间，全城突然热闹起来。
data.enText: The town springs into life (= becomes busy) during the carnival.
swing into action

data.chText: 立即行动起来；马上大干起来
data.enText: to start doing sth quickly and with a lot of energy

tr: something done (usually as opposed to something said)
example: there were stories of murders and other unnatural actions

tr: the most important or interesting work or activity in a specific area or field
example: the action is no longer in technology stocks but in municipal bonds
gawkers always try to get as close to the action as possible

tr: a judicial proceeding brought by one party against another
one party prosecutes another for a wrong done or for protection of a right or for prevention of a wrong
an act by a government body or supranational organization
example: recent federal action undermined the segregationist position
the United Nations must have the power to propose and organize action without being hobbled by irrelevant issues
the Union action of emancipating Southern slaves

tr: the operating part that transmits power to a mechanism
example: the piano had a very stiff action

tr: the trait of being active and energetic and forceful
the series of events that form a plot
example: his novels always have a lot of action

tr: a process existing in or produced by nature (rather than by the intent of human beings)

example: execute the decision of the people
He was warned that the district attorney would process him
She actioned the company for discrimination

value.def: Action is doing something for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The government is taking emergency action to deal with a housing crisis...
example.tran: 政府正采取紧急措施解决住房危机。

example.ex: What was needed, he said, was decisive action to halt what he called these savage crimes.
example.tran: 他说，当务之急就是采取果断行动制止他所称的“这些野蛮罪行”。

value.def: An action is something that you do on a particular occasion.

example.ex: As always, Peter had a reason for his action...
example.tran: 一如往常，彼得对自己的行为总有说辞。

example.ex: Jack was the sort of man who did not like his actions questioned.
example.tran: 杰克是那种不喜欢别人质疑自己行为的人。

value.def: To bring a legal action against someone means to bring a case against them in a court of law.

example.ex: Two leading law firms are to prepare legal actions against tobacco companies.
example.tran: 两家很有名的律师事务所准备向烟草公司提起诉讼。

example.ex: ...a libel action brought by one of France's bureaucrats.
example.tran: 由法国的一名官员提起的诽谤诉讼

value.def: The action of a chemical is the way in which it works, or the effects that it has.

example.ex: Her description of the nature and action of poisons is amazingly accurate.
example.tran: 他对一些毒药的性质和作用的描述惊人地准确。

value.def: The action is all the important and exciting things that are happening in a situation.

example.ex: Hollywood is where the action is now.

value.tran: 激动人心（或重要）的大事

value.def: The fighting which takes place in a war can be referred to as action .

example.ex: Leaders in America have generally supported military action...
example.tran: 美国领导人普遍支持采取军事行动。

example.ex: 13 soldiers were killed and 10 wounded in action.
example.tran: 战斗中有13名士兵阵亡，10名士兵受伤。

value.def: An action movie is a film in which a lot of dangerous and exciting things happen. An action hero is the main character in one of these films.

example.ex: Stallone wants to break away from his action-hero image.
example.tran: 史泰龙想要摆脱动作明星的形象。

value.tran: （电影）情节惊险刺激的；动作（片）的；动作片中的

value.def: If you action something that needs to be done, you deal with it.

example.ex: Documents can be actioned, or filed immediately.
example.tran: 文件可被立即处理或归档。

value.def: If someone or something is out of action, they are injured or damaged and cannot work or be used.

example.ex: He's been out of action for 16 months with a serious knee injury...
example.tran: 由于膝部严重受伤，他已停工16个月。

example.ex: They were trapped after the lifts went out of action.
example.tran: 电梯出现故障，他们被困在里面了。

value.tran: （因受伤或损坏）不能工作，失去作用，无法运转

value.def: If someone wants to have a piece of the action or a slice of the action, they want to take part in an exciting activity or situation, usually in order to make money or become more important.

example.ex: Holiday spots have seen a dramatic revival and tourist chiefs are competing for a slice of the action.
example.tran: 各个度假点重又呈现出一派兴旺景象，旅游业的龙头老大们都在争着分一杯羹。

value.tran: （通常为了赚钱或提高影响力）插手，参与

value.def: If you put an idea or policy into action, you begin to use it or cause it to operate.

example.ex: They have learned the lessons of business management theory, and put them into action.
example.tran: 他们不仅学习了商业管理理论方面的课程，并且学以致用。

trans: 在积极活动中，在活动；参加；在运行，在运转中；在起作用
行动计划；行动方案；执行计划；行动规划；实施方案
(尤指教育界为改进工作方法等而开展的)行动研究
民事诉讼（参见trials at common law）
药理作用；药物作用；效应药理作用；理作用
